00039 /**
00040 * @file application.h
00041 * @date 2008/06/04 11:46
00042 * @author Sergio Montenegro, Lutz Dittrich
00043 *
00044 * Copyright 2008 DLR
00045 *
00046 * @brief collection of information about an application (header)
00047 *
00048 */
00049 
00050 #pragma once
00051 
00052 #include "listelement.h"
00053 
00054 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00055 namespace RODOS {
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 /**
00059 * @class Application
00060 * @brief collection of information about an application.
00061 *
00062 * Registers applications names/versions to be printed and
00063 * to be searched for (discovery).
00064 * Each application gets a name which will be printed at system start up.
00065 * Each application has an optional applicationID number which can be used by
00066 * other applications to find it and to determine if it was loaded/linked or
00067 * not.
00068 */
00069 class Application: public ListElement {
00070     friend void initSystem();
00071 
00072 private:
00073     /** List of all registered applications.
00074     */
00075     static List applicationList;
00076 
00077     /// free usable to identify and find loaded modules by number/id
00078     int32_t applicationId;
00079 
00080 public:
00081     /** Constructor; Creates and registeres an application with given name
00082       * and id.
00083       * @param[in] name The name of the application.
00084       * @param[in] id The application id.
00085       */
00086     Application(const char* name, const int32_t id=1000);
00087 
00088     /** Destructor; Should never be called.
00089       */
00090     virtual ~Application();
00091 
00092     int32_t getID() const { return applicationId; }
00093 
00094     /** Prints all registered applications and corresponding IDs.
00095         (do not call before main())
00096     */
00097     static void printApplications();
00098 
00099     /** If the list contains an application with the given id then this
00100     *   functions returns a pointer to this application. If there is more
00101     *   than one application with that id, this function returns a pointer
00102     *   to the first one it encounters. In any other case
00103     *   this methode returns null.  (do not call before main())
00104     *   @param[in] id The id to search for.
00105     *   @return pointer to application with given id or null if not found.
00106     */
00107     static Application* findApplication(const int32_t id);
00108 
00109     /// to signal activate / deactivate applications
00110     bool isActivated;
00111 
00112     virtual void init(void) { } ///< calles by rodos::main at system start
00113 
00114     virtual void activate(); ///< user implemented to activate the application
00115     virtual void deactivate(); ///< user implemented to deactivate the application
00116 
00117     /** To send requests to applications, The application may answer.
00118       * @return number of bytes written in answerMsg, <0 -> error, -1 -> not implemented
00119       */
00120     virtual int32_t request(void* requestMsg, int len, void* answerMsg, int maxLen);
00121 
00122 };
00123 
00124 
00125 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00126 }
00127 #endif
